title: How It Works | Splits Network
description: A clear walkthrough of the split-fee recruiting process — from role posting to automated fee distribution. Understand the model before you engage.
author: Splits Network

blocks.subtitle: The split-fee model has connected recruiters for decades. Splits Network gives it the infrastructure to work at scale — transparent, tracked, and paid automatically.
blocks.imageAlt: Network diagram illustrating the connection between companies, recruiters, and candidates

blocks.heading: What Split-Fee Recruiting Actually Means
paragraphs: In traditional recruiting, a single agency owns the relationship with both the company and the candidate. They collect the full placement fee. Split-fee recruiting changes that dynamic: the hiring company posts a role, any qualified recruiter can engage, and when a placement is made, the fee is divided between the job-posting party and the placing recruiter.

The result is broader candidate coverage for companies, access to more roles for recruiters, and a marketplace where specialization is rewarded. Everyone earns based on their contribution. Splits Network is the platform that makes this model operationally viable — handling agreements, pipelines, and payments in one place.

blocks.heading: From Role Posted to Placement Paid
blocks.subtitle: Five clear steps. Every stage is tracked on the platform so all parties have full visibility.

steps.title: Company Posts a Role
steps.description: A hiring company creates a role listing with job requirements, compensation range, and fee structure. They set the total placement fee and the split percentage — for example, 20% of first-year salary, split 50/50. Terms are public before any recruiter engages.

steps.title: Recruiters Discover and Engage
steps.description: Specialized recruiters browse the marketplace and engage with roles matching their expertise and candidate network. Each engagement is a formal agreement — the recruiter sees and accepts the fee terms before beginning work.

steps.title: Candidates Are Matched and Submitted
steps.description: Engaged recruiters submit candidates through the platform. AI matching scores each submission against the role requirements. Hiring managers review candidates in their shared ATS pipeline, advance them through stages, and coordinate interviews.

steps.title: Placement Is Made
steps.description: When the hiring company makes an offer and the candidate accepts, the placement is confirmed on the platform. The system logs the start date, verifies the hire, and begins the guarantee period clock.

steps.title: Fees Split Automatically
steps.description: After the guarantee period passes, the placement fee is calculated against the confirmed compensation. The company is invoiced via Stripe. The placing recruiter's share is paid out automatically. Every amount is visible to all parties.

blocks.heading: One Posting, Many Recruiters
paragraphs: When a role goes live on Splits Network, it reaches every recruiter in the network simultaneously. Specialists engage based on their expertise — not based on who has an existing agency relationship with you.

items.title: Broader Reach
items.body: Multiple recruiters working a single role means more candidate pathways. You're no longer dependent on one agency's network.

items.title: Full Visibility
items.body: See every submission, every pipeline stage, every recruiter interaction. Nothing happens off-platform.

items.title: Pay on Results
items.body: No retainers, no upfront fees. You pay a placement fee only when a hire is made.

blocks.heading: Access Every Role, Earn What You Place
paragraphs: The marketplace is open. Any recruiter can browse all posted roles and engage with those matching their specialization. Fee terms are visible upfront — no negotiation, no ambiguity.

items.title: Filter to Your Niche
items.body: Search by industry, role type, location, and fee range. Only engage with roles where you have a genuine competitive edge.

items.title: Submit With Confidence
items.body: Your submission is tracked, time-stamped, and attributed. You always know where your candidates stand.

items.title: Transparent Earnings
items.body: Your split percentage is locked when you engage. No surprises when the placement closes.

blocks.quote: The split-fee model has existed for decades. What's changed is the infrastructure to make it work at scale. That's what Splits Network built.

cards.title: Companies Get Coverage
cards.description: Broader recruiter engagement means more qualified candidates, faster. Competition among recruiters keeps quality high.

cards.title: Recruiters Get Access
cards.description: Independent recruiters can work premium roles that would otherwise require an agency relationship to reach.

cards.title: Terms Are Enforceable
cards.description: Every agreement is recorded on the platform. Dispute resolution is built in. No handshake deals, no missing paperwork.

items.question: What happens if a candidate declines after an offer is made?
items.answer: The placement is not confirmed until the candidate starts. If an offer is declined, the role remains active and engaged recruiters can continue submitting. No fee is triggered.

items.question: How long is the standard guarantee period?
items.answer: The guarantee period is set by the hiring company when they post the role — typically 30, 60, or 90 days. If the candidate leaves within that period, the fee is either refunded or a replacement candidate is sourced, per the agreed terms.

items.question: Can multiple recruiters submit the same candidate?
items.answer: The platform tracks first-submission attribution. If two recruiters submit the same candidate, the first submission holds. This protects the recruiting community and ensures clear credit.

items.question: What if I'm both the job-poster and the placing recruiter?
items.answer: That's a standard scenario. Recruiting agencies can post roles and work them internally while also opening them to the broader network for split engagement. You control who sees the role and on what terms.
